channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Iran's nuclear program set back 'a few months.' And, Trump to meet with NATO allies
item.description: An early assessment by the Defense Intelligence Agency believes the damage to Iran's most important nuclear site was limited. And, Trump will meet with NATO allies today to discuss a spending increase.
item.content:encoded: An early assessment by the Defense Intelligence Agency believes the damage to Iran's most important nuclear site was limited. And, Trump will meet with NATO allies today to discuss a spending increase.
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Trump is slated to hold a press conference at the NATO summit
item.description: The news conference is scheduled for 9 a.m. ET at the conclusion of the summit in the Netherlands as the world watches to see whether a ceasefire between Israel and Iran will endure.
item.content:encoded:
The news conference is scheduled for 9 a.m. ET at the conclusion of the summit in the Netherlands as the world watches to see whether a ceasefire between Israel and Iran will endure.

(Image credit: Francis Chung)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: RFK Jr.'s picks for CDC vaccine advisers meet this week amid controversy
item.description: For the first time since Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. replaced all the members of the vaccine committee, it is meeting in Atlanta.
item.content:encoded:
For the first time since Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. replaced all the members of the vaccine committee, it is meeting in Atlanta.

(Image credit: Alyssa Pointer for The Washington Post)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Brother to Bruh: How Gen Alpha slang has its origins in the 16th century
item.description: What was once another shortened way to call a friend "brother," the word "bruh" is now being used widely, especially by Gen Alpha kids, to address parents, express sadness, frustration, happiness and seemingly everything else under the sun.
item.content:encoded:
What was once another shortened way to call a friend "brother," the word "bruh" is now being used widely, especially by Gen Alpha kids, to address parents, express sadness, frustration, happiness and seemingly everything else under the sun.

(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Just got laid off? Get back on your feet with this step-by-step guide
item.description: When you lose your job, it can be tough to know what to do next. Career coach Octavia Goredema shares a practical checklist of next moves, from reviewing exit paperwork to securing health care.
item.content:encoded:
When you lose your job, it can be tough to know what to do next. Career coach Octavia Goredema shares a practical checklist of next moves, from reviewing exit paperwork to securing health care.

(Image credit: Westend61)
item.dc:creator: Margaret Cirino

item.title: Why a war in the Middle East hasn't sparked an oil crisis
item.description: Global crude oil prices are now lower than they were before Israel attacked Iran earlier this month. A price spike did occur, but it was short-lived — unlike oil crises of the past.
item.content:encoded:
Global crude oil prices are now lower than they were before Israel attacked Iran earlier this month. A price spike did occur, but it was short-lived — unlike oil crises of the past.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Trump's pick for appeals judge seen as 'ill-suited' to lifetime appointment
item.description: The nomination of the president's former personal lawyer Emil Bove to an appellate judgeship could represent a pivot point in Trump's approach to the judiciary.
item.content:encoded:
The nomination of the president's former personal lawyer Emil Bove to an appellate judgeship could represent a pivot point in Trump's approach to the judiciary.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Six things to know about Iran's supreme leader
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep profiles Iran's supreme leader, who is deciding on his next steps after a ceasefire with Israel.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Steve Inskeep profiles Iran's supreme leader, who is deciding on his next steps after a ceasefire with Israel.

(Image credit: Office of the Iranian Supreme Leader)
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Why America's giant bunker-busting bombs may have failed to reach their target
item.description: Reaching Iran's most fortified nuclear enrichment site is a challenge, even for the world's biggest conventional weapons.
item.content:encoded:
Reaching Iran's most fortified nuclear enrichment site is a challenge, even for the world's biggest conventional weapons.

(Image credit: 509th Bomb Wing)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Dispatches from the living memory of trans people of color
item.description: Trans people are major targets of the second Trump administration. But in a way, that's nothing new; trans people have been fighting for their rights, dignity, and liberation for generations. So on this episode, we hear from trans elders about what their lives have looked like over the decades, and what messages they have for young people.
item.content:encoded: Trans people are major targets of the second Trump administration. But in a way, that's nothing new; trans people have been fighting for their rights, dignity, and liberation for generations. So on this episode, we hear from trans elders about what their lives have looked like over the decades, and what messages they have for young people.
item.dc:creator: Jess Kung
